cs351.entities

Class RandomLevelGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • cs351.entities.RandomLevelGenerator

  • public class RandomLevelGenerator
extends javafx.application.Application
    Author:
    Chris Sanchez This class creates a procedurally generated level map. The following algorithm explains the process: 1.) Fill entire map with a rectangular Wall, initialize a queue with this one large area. 2.) While the queue still has "Areas" waiting in line, take the front area, (or head) and divide it a.) If (we don't have 6 hallways created yet) AND (The area is large enough) Then carve out a straight line (hallway), rotating 90 degrees each time. Add both blocks (either side first) back to the queue. b.) Else-If the area is still too big Then cut the area in half (pick a random spot) and add both sides back into the queue. Else carve out the final room and stop because you have enough rooms. Credit for this algorithm: http://www.polygonpi.com/?p=1191, Chris Sanchez

    • Method Detail

      • initializeBoard

        public void initializeBoard()
        This is where the action begins. A board perimeter is created, Blocks or "chunks" where the rooms will exist are formed. The halls are connected, and finally the rooms get connected.

      • splitDirection_IsVertical

        public boolean splitDirection_IsVertical()
        Alternate between vertical and horizontal division of rooms
        Returns:
        - true if the split direction needs to be vertical, false if it needs to be horizontal

      • changeSplitDir

        public boolean changeSplitDir()
        Returns:
        - true if Vertical, false if Horizontal

      • divideAreaOne

        public void divideAreaOne(RandomLevelGenerator firstInQueue)
        This divide the initial Area of the level map. Since no other rooms have been placed in the queue, Only one chunk gets divided at first
        Parameters:
        firstInQueue -

      • divideAreas

        public void divideAreas(RandomLevelGenerator firstInQueue,
                        RandomLevelGenerator secondInQueue)
        This will divide the first and second Room object waiting in the queue. The direction of the split alternates with each pass. The number of rooms that need to be divided grow 2 ^ n times. The first pass is 2 ... then 4 ... then 8 ... etc
        Parameters:
        firstInQueue -
        secondInQueue -

      • verticalDivide

        public void verticalDivide(RandomLevelGenerator firstInQueue,
                           int randomNumber)
        Makes a vertical split down the middle of each chunk of block. First it adds the two haves to the queue. As they are being added, offset space is created to make hallways
        Parameters:
        firstInQueue -
        randomNumber -

      • horizontalDivide

        public void horizontalDivide(RandomLevelGenerator firstInQueue,
                             int randomNumber)
        Creates a horizontal split down the middle of each chunk. Offset space is created to make hallways.
        Parameters:
        firstInQueue -
        randomNumber -

      • getRandomNumber

        public int getRandomNumber(RandomLevelGenerator firstInQueue,
                           boolean splitIsVertical)
        Finds a random spot either on a horizontal or vertical edge, and uses that as a "pivot" to divide the chunks of Rooms. The upper and lower bound variables restrict the line division between 1/3 and 2/3. the reason for this is so the hallways and borders don't end up too close to another wall
        Parameters:
        firstInQueue -
        splitIsVertical -
        Returns:
